title: Městský stadion (Benešov)
text:
Městský stadion, also known as Stadion u Konopiště is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Bene%C5%A1ov">Benešov</a>, <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a>. It is the home stadium of <a href="SK%20Bene%C5%A1ov">SK Benešov</a>. It hosted top-flight football in the <a href="1994%E2%80%9395%20Gambrinus%20liga">1994–95 season</a>. The stadium holds 8,000 spectators.
The ground was the location of a pitch invasion by <a href="AC%20Sparta%20Prague">Sparta Prague</a> fans on 4 March 1995, resulting in home team goalkeeper <a href="Martin%20Pa%C5%99%C3%ADzek">Martin Pařízek</a> being rendered unconscious. The Czech Football Association fined the home team 30,000 <a href="Czech%20koruna">Czech koruna</a> for the incident and instructed the club to play its next home game at least from Benešov.
